data.title: Anniversary dinner
data.text: Nice atmosphere. Waiter lingered a little too long. Talked my wife out of her order- said her selection wasn't that special. If so, why is it on the menu? Steak was perhaps the best I've ever had- literally melt in your mouth. Asparagus was barely cooked- I understand not wanting to cook it limp, but this was very crispy. The lobster mac 'n cheese was a heavy app that is plenty for 2 people. We passed on dessert after having already spent $100. Overall nice place I'd like to try again but would only be for a special occasion.

data.title: Leisure
data.text: Not bad for lunch menu. Had steak and cheese with fries. Fries were a little over cooked. Service was good.

data.title: BEAUTIFUL IN EVERY WAY
data.text: I had lunch here in the old bank building, and it was really great.  Go for the food and enjoy all the rest.   Nice rooms are available all with lots of ambiance.  Service was perfect.  The table, chairs, utensils, glassware, and napkins were spotless.  Cobb salad was perfect.  Others got the hamburger which was a feast for the eyes, and, according to the eaters, really the best burger they had in months.  The prices were very good.  I'll go back and may even make a 2 hr trek to Tyler just to eat here again.  Jack Ryan's does it right!

data.title: Romantic, perfect
data.text: An elegant, romantic, DELICIOUS evening.  I would expect to have to go to Dallas to find a restaurant to rival Jack Ryan's.  Worth every penny!

data.title: Great Food. Steak, burgers ...no better. Mashed potatoes and w chicken
data.text: fried chick or steak very very good. Fried green tomato topped with lump crab and aioli is treat. Don't skip desserts!

data.title: Just Awesome!!
data.text: I don't think I will be able to say enough about this place. Great service.. Very helpful and attentive. The food was out of this world!!   Tenderloin will melt in your mouth. Everyone at the table said their dinner was excellent!!  If you go I know you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Best steak in Tyler!
data.text:
We picked Jack Ryan's for our anniversary dinner this year and it did not disappoint. When you first enter the foyer and see the grandeur of the staircase that leads up to the restaurant, you begin to realize you are in for a special experience. You are greeted at the grand front desk and with reservations made weeks in advance, immediately taken to your table. 

We were seated in a small room with only about 7 tables. Windows were abundant with views of downtown Tyler. Even with a party at every table, the room was pleasantly quiet and it was comfortable holding a private table conversation.

The manager treated us with a complimentary glass of champagne for our anniversary, it was an excellent champagne and a nice treat! I ordered the signature Hibiscus Margarita and Allan ordered a martini. My marg was fruity and flowery tasting, very light and wonderful! Allan proclaimed his martini was made by someone who knows how to make a martini. As a martini snob, he gave it a "thumbs up". 

We ordered the Bruschetta appetizer, it was fresh and delicious tomato, basil and cheese served on perfectly crispy bread. For our main course, we both chose the 8 oz tenderloin. We usually try to order different meals, but neither of us could say no to this cut of steak. I'm not sure I fully understood the description of how they prepare their beef. It involved individually packaging, some sorta slow 60 degree bathing process, I'm not at all sure what else. But whatever it is, it resulted in the absolute greatest steak I've ever tasted. Phenomenal. Perfect. Amazing. All the superlatives apply. This steak is worth it. We also ordered the Lobster Mac N Cheese appetizer as side dish to share, it was wonderful! 

The service was spot on perfect! Jesse was there when we needed him, and never once appeared when we were invested in our meal or experience. It was truly the perfect amount of service. 

As we were exiting, we crossed paths with the owner and complimented him personally on his restaurant. This was not just a courtesy compliment, it was well earned. We will return to Jack Ryan's for special occasion meals time after time in our future. This is an amazing restaurant and should become a destination for all East Texas residents!

data.title: A really good restaurant in Tyler
data.text: I have eaten lunch at Jack Ryan's many times.  Great food.  Great value.  Great atmosphere.  It is a good spot for a business lunch.  It is also a great spot to meet people at night.  Recommend it highly

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: Jack Ryan's if one of the nicer restaurants to visit when in Tyler, Texas. We have been three times and each meal is good.  The pork chop is outstanding.  Everyone seems to enjoy themselves.  Slightly upscale venue.  Great for couples and business meetings.

data.title: Great
data.text: Celebrated our anniversary there and it was really nice. Good food and nice service. The lemon drop martinis were excellent.

data.title: Ambiance nice, Food average
data.text: Selected the Chefs special and our beef was over cooked. Veggies were average as well. Such a specially designed location, beautiful art deco decor, you can tell a great deal of attention went into the presentation of the restaurant, too bad they stopped short on their food.

data.title: Better and better
data.text: Top flight place, a solid team and nice concept. Each visit shows improvement in service. Food always very good.

data.title: Great Lunch and Dinner!
data.text: The lunch menu is excellent, and reasonably priced. Dinner can be a bit pricey but worth it for an amazing steak! I really enjoy the atmosphere of this art deco building and the friendly staff is always helpful.

data.title: great atmosphere and service; ok food
data.text: The atmosphere in one of the old historic petroleum buildings on the square is unmatched.  Service is excellent.  food not quite to the level that we expected.  Would definitely return however!

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
What a great deal, in a super looking eatery. 3 of us had a lunch for the first time. The building is quite elegant. Marble walls, a great stair case, and seating that would mimic a 5 star eatery. The menu is quite simple and down to earth. I had a Philly cheese sandwich plate. But, boy, it's up scale. 95% of the meals were under 11.00. The service is excellent. I felt I was cheating the eatery. 
Parking is poor. But overall, this eatery is one you got to visit.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: Really enjoyed a nice night out with friends. Great venue and atmosphere in this refurbished bank building. Wait staff was fantastic. Music was perfect volume. We got there at 6:30 and before we realized it, it was 9:00. Pricy, but in line with the service, food and ambiance. A rare gem for east Texas. Great job JR!

data.title: Great place
data.text:
Excellent food, service and atmosphere.  Very nice establishment.  Music just right.  Had the ribeye, twice baked potato, asparagus and salad.  Started off with the crab cakes. You haven't had crab cake before.  Not like this. Not that bready stuff you're familiar with. This was CRAB and a delicious sauce.
Ribeye was so large, I took the rest home and made a full meal from it the next day.
And for a fine-dining place, the prices were reasonable.  Of course, you don't eat like this every day, right?

data.title: Really good, but expensive
data.text: Great food, but pricey.  Good atmosphere, and friendly waitstaff.  Food is excellent, with a good variety.

data.title: Best Steak in town!
data.text: Having dined at their location in Kilgore many times, we we very excited when they opened a location in Tyler! The food, service, atmosphere, everything is just fantastic. They have a nice bar upstairs overlooking the Resturant with an excellent selection of wine, spirits and beers. There are only a handful of fine dining options in Tyler, and it is my opinion Jack Ryan's is the best in town.

data.title: I've waited for this & it's here!
data.text:
Many restaurants pretend to have fine and gracious dining, 99.9% fail. It's either poor staff training or an over ambitious kitchen. We ate at Jack Ryan's in Tyler yesterday for lunch. They promised and they delivered, boom. 
Our waitperson knew his menu, the techniques the kitchen used and made a very nice wine recommendation. But most notable was a genuine desire to serve. The setting is sharp and we do plan to go back for dinner. Tyler has needed something like this. Glad to recommend.
